author: {'steamid': '76561198371369475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1686930175}
review:
Early access for 6 years, yet still no optimization for low-end computers (my computer is high-end but my game was insanely laggy before I got my new computer) and weird platforms. What I mean by weird is that sometimes you drop down because you're at the edge of the platform, and also the speed is very odd for a 3D platformer. The FOV meter doesn't even work either. The last update was almost 6 years ago. Half a decade of time to make your game better but still no update.

I don't know why I even bought the game all these years ago. Waste of money

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2465, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1599887662}
review:
만들다 중단된 느낌....?

점프 게임입니다.
점프점프하면서 오브젝트 위를 넘어가고
목표 지점으로 이동해야하는 게임이죠.

오브젝트와의 사이에 맞춰서 점프 타이밍을 맞추면 되고,
벽을 차서 약간 2단 점프 느낌을 주기도 하는데....
뭔가 만들다가 중단된 느낌이 드는 게임입니다.

게임 모드 중 하나는 활성화 날짜가 적혀있는데 이미 그 날짜는 지나있는 상태이고,
메인 모드는 순서대로만 플레이할 수 있고 중간에 클리어한 스테이지를 이용할 수 없더군요.
5스테이지까지 진행해도 게임을 나가면 1부터 다시해야하는....
그런데 게임 가격이....?

아쉬운 점
-미개발/ 개발 중단 느낌
-이어하기 불가
-애매한 컨트롤

review: Ну что тут скажешь, весёлый такой раннер с девятью левелами (больше пока не завезли, хотя вроде собираются). Музыка приятная и настраивает на быструю игру. Графика нормальная, тут лучше и не нужно (главное глаза не режет). Но проходится она моментально, буквально за полчаса, а за час можно всё на платину перепройти. Так что своих денег явно не стоит, но вот по скидке можно взять. В целом неплохо, но мало, буквально на один вечер. Так что ждём контента)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985566944', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1551036580}
review:
VThree got a bit ahead of itself and put together a lot of great levels for a speedplatformer before making sure movement felt good. I was hoping for another game like Refunct, but the handling in this game is not crisp at alll. Jump arcs don't feel right. Midair angle adjustment doesn't feel right. Acceleration, momentum, and wall jump angles and timing all feel a bit like they were slapped on to a game not about movement just to get the checkboxes on the back of the box; but in this game, that's all there is.

On top of that vital audio cues for a first-person platformer (like landing from a jump) are missing or muffled, and the lack of textures and complex lighting make it sometimes hard to intuit your speed or direction (e.g. when facing a large wall where every pixel is the same soft grey).

author: {'steamid': '76561198121621781', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1547759209}
review:
So, I think I'm gonna have to give this game a positive review despite the fact that I really want to give it a negative. Overall, I think the game is pretty good. Although short, it is a fairly challenging first person platformer/parkour. I thouroughly enjoyed the eight or so levels it currently has. It can be a bit of a hassle when you just can't get the timing of a jump down or when you try to walljump but can't tell how far away you are due to the fact that the wall doesn't have any details to help you perceive depth, but nonetheless I find the game fun. Is 8 dollars a little too much for what it is currently offering? I would say so. My general rule is at least 1 dollar an hour. This game probably takes about 2 hour to get a platinum medal on every single leve.

But here's the thing, actually cannot get every achievement. Why is this? Well, its the same reason that I want to give it a negative review. The game used to have MORE LEVELS and rocket jumping. I don't really know why but they decided to remove this content alltogether. As much as I want to go back and get a platinum medal on those levels that were previously there, I am not able to due to the fact that they were removed entirely. I understand that the game is early access and will go through constant changes, but I do not for the life of me understand why they removed that part of the game entirely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368070427', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1543157867}
review:
およそPVのような爽快感とはほど遠く、ひたすら繰り返しタイムアタックするゲームです。

ＳＨＩＦＴキーを押しっぱなしにしなければ走ることが出来ず指が疲れる。
細かい操作を要求され肉体的、精神的な疲労につながります。

あといくつかのステージのアップデートが削除されていると思われるため、実績は二度と解除できないのがいくつかあります。

セールで安くなっていたため購入したが、とてもじゃないが定価で買う価値は無いと思われます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029642835', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1529808429}
review: I can't really reccommend this, it's got a lot wrong with its presentation and level design. This game is very short, and expects a lot more than is reasonable from the player while introducing mechanics more quickly than someone who isn't a developer for the game could actually get used to them. If you want a fast-paces platformer that laughs at your failures while remaining fair, and has tons more content, play Seum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190012371', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1540643572}
review:
[h1]Vorwort[/h1]
Seitdem dieses Spiel in meiner Bibliothek liegt, habe ich es bisher einmal angefasst. Um es nach 6 Minuten wieder dezuinstallieren. Doch warum? Das erzähle ich euch in dieser Review.

[h1]Review[/h1]
Nach dem Start des Spiels werden wir von einem wunderbaren Dubstep-Soundtrack begrüßt. Dubstep, yeeeeeey.
Im Hauptmenü können wir zwischen den normalen Leveln und einen Speedrun-Modus entscheiden. Eine Story o. ä. besitzt das Spiel nicht. Also, fangen wir doch direkt mit dem Ersten der neun Leveln an. Nach ungefähr 6 Sekunden ist das Level auch schon vorbei. Man läuft eine Rampe hoch und springt über eine Säule: Ende. Nachdem wir in jedem Ziel 2 Sekunden warten müssen, und das Spiel schon fast so aussieht, als wäre es abgestürzt, weil das Menü nicht lädt, können wir direkt ins nächste Level, aufgebaut nach dem selben Schema: Lauf' die Rampe hoch und spring über ein paar Säulen. Nur das diesmal die Map größer ist, was durch die schwammige Steuerung, die teilweise unkontrollierbar ist, da der Charakter zu schnell läuft, und sobald man aufhört zu laufen sofort stoppt, dazu führt, dass man öfters herunterfällt, wodurch man entweder mühselig in das Pausemenü gehen muss, um das Level neuzustarten, oder wieder zum Anfang laufen muss, was eher eine schlechte Idee für ein Spiel, dass eigentlich auf dem Prinzip des Speedruns basiert, ist. Oh, und das Spiel hat auch Sounds, wobei ich die Soundeffekte hier keine nennen würde, da diese sich, genauso wie die Steuerung, falsch anfühlen. Selbst auf der niedrigsten Lautstärke sind diese viel zu laut (1/10). Da hilft nur noch eins: Stummschalten. Nachdem wir also ein weiteres Manko dieses Spiels eliminiert haben, geht es weiter ins nächste Level. Diesmal bin ich kurz davor ins Hauptmenü gegangen und wollte durch die Levelauswahl das Level wieder erreichen, doch ich konnte, obwohl beide Level bereits geschafft waren, nicht direkt eins davon auswählen, nur das Erste war möglich, da ich darauf keine Lust hatte, wollte ich mir den am Anfang genannten Speedrun-Modus anschauen. Oh: Coming 11/21/2017. Ehm. Das hätte ich jetzt nicht erwartet. Also mal eben auf die Steam-Seite gegangen, und geschaut, ob sich darüber schon jemand beschwert hat. Oh. "Presently in Early Access with an anticipated exit from EA on January 17th." Und das ist der Haken. Der Entwickler ist inaktiv und das Spiel wird seit Ewigkeiten nicht mehr weiterentwickelt. Kommen wir also zum Fazit.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Trotz einer schönen Optik, kann ich das Spiel aufgrund der schlecht umgesetzen Spielmechanik und dem fehlenden Inhalt nicht weiterempfehlen. Wer ein gutes Speedrun-Spiel sucht ist bei SEUM oder Clustertruck sicher besser aufgehoben.

[code]Disclaimer: Ich habe dieses Spiel zu Review-Zwecken kostenlos erhalten, dies beeinflusst jedoch in keinster Weise meine Meinung zu diesem Spiel.[/code]

review: Farklı dikkat çekici bir parkur deneyimi sunmuyor basit parkur fizikleri var ve pek iyi değil. Oyunda koşarken, sağa sola bakarken, bi yerden düşerken yani kısaca hareket edereken sanki oyun takılıyomuş gibi geliyo. Dolayısıyla hiç akıcı bir oyun deneyimi sunmuyor. İnsan bir motion blur ekler, kamera sallanma efekti falan ekler, animasyonları güçlendirir falan bir şeyler yapar ama bu herifler yapmamış. Bölüm sayısı da az. Atölye destekliyo ama atölyesi de boş. Tek beğendiğim kısmı Quality kısmında Sexy veya Fast seçeneği olması.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174314979', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1530414225}
review:
This game, oh god this game. Where do I begin?
(Specs are an i7 8th gen, a 940mx, and 16GB of DDR3 RAM)
Pros:
- It was cheap when I bought it, so luckily I didn't waste money
- Nice UI

CONS:
- The performance is shitty, even on the lowest setting
- The FOV slider doesn't even work
- The controls were so delayed
- - Games don't make me motion sick, but this one did because of it
- There's only 10 levels. I'm not sure if this is planned to be fixed, but given how difficult it is to play you'll be at this for days if you don't throw up
- It may look visually pleasing, but you'll be lucky if you get anything from it
- You can try to scale this game down all you want, it'll still run like shit

Allenal, don't buy this game if you don't have a supercomputer or are looking for a game similar to Refunct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094455100', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1690841471}
review:
This is pretty much a scam or intencional demo version. 
You only get tutorial levels, the rest were deleted long ago so you might have to find older version on the internet.

Found one of the version : open steam console and type :download_depot 567320 567321 3958383354976894960
Then when its done just delete the current version and copy or move the old version in its place.

if it wants to update use : app_update_cancel 1

author: {'steamid': '76561198382590749', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1513387868}
review: Great concept of a game, but poorly executed. The wall jumps are very inconsistent, plenty of hacked leaderboard times, and the fov meter doesn't even work, what the hell?
developer_response:
Hey! Bummer that you're having issues. I checked the leaderboards, and none of the times are hacks. If you hop on the Discord there are a bunch of people there who will be happy to help you nail the side step speed run maneuver. 

As for the FOV slider, that's a bug I haven't seen before. If you hook me up with system details I can take a look and try to make sure it's fixed in the next patch.

You're right about wall jumps being difficult. That was by design, but perhaps it's little harder than it should be. I'm open to adjusting the difficulty there if there is some consensus. Stuff like this gets hammered out on the Discord, so stop in!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112260862', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1512736053}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169630300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1603246695}
review: I haven't yet even been able to play the game, but I'm going to recommend it. I love these types of parkour - timed games, but a very good reason that I'm recommending is the creator of the game. I posted a comment that I was having trouble loading the game up, and he replied within a matter of days, or in the same day possibly (I wasn't paying much attention myself - I don't often find that people always reply so quickly). He is very willing to work with you, and figure out what the problem is. If you love these kinds of games, I would have to recommend this one. I appreciate his efforts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159728475', 'num_games_owned': 1134, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1501066229}
review:
[h1]Testing out a new style of review. Leave feedback on what you dislike/like about it![/h1]

[h1]Brief Rating and description about this game[/h1]
VThree is a SP and MP parkour race game where you must get to the objective at all costs. This game tests your reaction skills, speed and button mashing. It is important that you know that concentration is key. This game is very difficult on singleplayer when you’re against a clock but when against a real life person, this game can become insanely intense. This game is amazing and cannot wait for full launch. I rate it 7/10 for its current content. 

[h1]Highlights[/h1]
Beautiful concept
Simple but detailed graphics
Nice variety of different maps
Very optimised
Fast working developers

[h1]Dislikes[/h1]
Insanely difficult
Some Server Lag

[b]Please don’t forget to leave feedback and vote the review :steamhappy:[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198004255126', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1499088283}
review:
Searching for good fpp platformer on steam is hard. I bought V3, and already thinking about refund.

The game is horribly optimised, even with 120 fps on a counter, the game is incredible stuttery which brings to me awful experience. The movement is bunny hoppy/strafe'y. Of course it's not like in quake engines, but still a good attempt. Based on speedrun.com records, it looks like the game is insanely broken and times are optimised so it's almost impossible to reach top in the leaderboards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076710530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1499041278}

The audio is crazy loud when you first launch it, took me 10 mins to get out of the settings (which i eventually just restarted the game), and rocket jumping seems quite difficult when you first try it but with time, you can get better. 

When you are in low setting like me, i could barely see the text in the settings, the background could be changed, and brightness could be changed as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127957838', 'num_games_owned': 14814, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1512787839}
review:
I received a copy of this game as a gift, not necessarily for promotion, but I think it's worthy of a positive review and some minor promotion on my part.

Overall, this is a fun game. Completing levels is a bit of a challenge at first, but getting a platinum rating (or at least trying to) is really fun, albeit sometimes a little frustrating. (You may rage quit.) The concept is a fairly basic bunny hop game, with a little less speed than I've seen in some others. However, getting top ratings is not purely skill, but also involves some puzzle solving as well, as you usually have to bypass some part of the main course to get it. That being said, if you like skill-based/precision-based challenges, you should be happy.

The art style is to my own personal liking. Low-poly objects with no textures works for me. The music is good, not repetitive at all to me, which is a bit of a pet peeve of mine. The beginning levels are relatively simple and ease you into the core game at a good pace, but the challenge definitely scales up as you move on to other areas.

I will note that there are some areas/obstacles in which I found myself getting stuck (literally, stuck on the wall - not 'I can't beat') and in one instance, my power-up wouldn't stop firing. These are minor bugs and are not game breaking, but that can make it more time consuming to progress.

Gameplay video showing some of the shortcut/platinum solutions on early levels as well as the bugs noted above: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=922968182

author: {'steamid': '76561198164147796', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1494763384}
review:
Boy oh boy, we have a hidden gem on our hands here. This game is unbeliveably addictive, going for the platinums is a lot of fun. Considering this game is in early access and is only 2 months old, it's absolutely brilliant. I cannot wait for new content. Believe me, it may be some random indie game but oh my lord! It's worth your money. Definitely recommend considering the price. 9/10 (-1 for minor annoying bugs such as getting caught on walls and hitboxes being a tid bit too big but they're easy to fix.)

Edit,
      you will encounter a few crashes here and therebut not as often as some games. Also, if it says it's stopped responding just click wait till the program responds and it'll load up practically instantly. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969364344', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1490663422}
review:
Pro:
-gorgeous graphics

As it currently stands, the jump physics are driving me crazy. It's early access, so maybe that will change.

I found out about this game because I was playing Seum, which is more or less the same idea, except Seum has Super Meat Boy style traps. I have 600+ deaths on Seum in 2 hours of play. It's pretty difficult (though probably easier than SMB to be fair). Both games have you jumping platform to platform at fairly high speeds and have a variety of power ups.

So why do I not like VThree?

Simple: jump distance. It just doesn't feel right in VThree. In Seum, I can jump over numerous platforms, having to aim and lob grenades while I do it. I miss platforms all the time and die, but more often than not, I make individual jumps, just not a string of 12 when that happens.

In VThree, by the second TUTORIAL level, I was already frustrated enough with the jumping that I exited the game. 

You can never just hit forward and jump at the right time, because the platforms aren't spaced relative to your jump distances. The next platform seems to be some awkward distance that's not even close.

So if you're imagining rapid forward movement where you hold the W key and just hit space at the right time... this game isn't it. You have to not only jump at the right time, but also finesse exactly how far forward you're going. It's fiddly and it's frustrating. I'm failing jumps not because the jump itself looks difficult or because you're moving quickly and need to string a bunch of jumps together. Even basic jumps in this game are infuriating to me.

I'm all for difficult games, but something is wrong if even the tutorial is frustratingly difficult.

Now, it's early access, and one of the things they're going to change between now and release is "Finalized Controls." If they tweak the player's move speed / jump distance a little, with the same levels, I think I'd really like this game. But for now, having to nudge backwards while mid-air (or frequently let go of forward in an attempt to slow down so that you don't vastly overshoot the next platform) is a common sort of thing, and it's just not fun for me because of that. Almost all of these sorts of games have you more or less keep a constant move speed and relatively consistent jump distances.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972503165', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1488461652}
review:
Persönlich hatte ich große Hoffnung in das Spiel gesetzt.
Das Spiel wurde mir aufgrund von Cluster Truck empfohlen und ich wartete auf den Release von Vthree. Als das Spiel am 1. März 2017 erschien, griff ich direkt zu und kaufte mir das Spiel.

Ich startete es, spielte es 6 Minuten lang und habe es danach rückerstatten lassen. Wieso?
Das Spiel läuft permanent auf ca. 90fps, hat aber dennoch ein ziemlich "zittriges" gameplay. Wenn man darauf achtet, bemerkt man es und es fühlt sich an wie eine gewisse Verzögerung im Spiel. Es ist kein technischer Fehler, jedoch ein Gameplay-Element, das mir nicht zusagt und sich nicht gut
oder spaßig anfühlt.

Für mich persönlich unspielbar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338563047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1498076567}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048465408', 'num_games_owned': 1508, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1513941645}
review:
目前不建议入手，可以多等等，以后修的差不多了再入。
现阶段还不是很完善，手感以及判定感觉需要多调整。关卡很少，难度不低。
单说游戏自带的PsyTrance特别棒，做的挺好的。但是感觉并不适合游戏……单独听的话，psytrance爱好者应该还能接受。
帧数比较低，操作有点感人，速度感不强。火箭跳比较传统，还行，但是跑步必须按着shift才能快跑小指头特别累。
凑合。

author: {'steamid': '76561198175273301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1491006745}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114127820', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1591841306}
review:
DISCLAIMER FOR THOSE WITH LACK OF THINKNG: GAME IS IN EARY ACCESS, MEANING THERE WILL BE PROBLEMS BUT BECAUSE ITS EA THAT MEANS YOU CAN DO SOMETHING AND BRING UP SAID PROBLEMS AND HAVE THEM FIXED ASAP.

Now back to my review. I got this game because I enjoy fast paced parkour styled game and this answers. My best comparison is faster paced source parkour but it's not exactly the same. There are fun lil gadgets that can help you reach your goal or you can just play around with them because screw the rules. As for the price tag, imagine being a father with children to feed, enough said. As far as issues go I don't have problems with it, it is a solid game for being made by one man. 

Ending thoughts: not everyone's cup o joe but give it a shot and if any tech issues come up just remember, YOU CAN DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996278242', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1511371047}

Hello,

Its currently in a super early stage but its amazing. If you buy this game take some minutes to get into it and atleast try. Dont give up to early and just have fun :)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004914985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1488512790}
review:
Let me preface this by saying that yes, I do only have less than 10 minutes in the game. Now onto the problems that I had in said first 10 minutes. 

           1st. In-Game sounds and Music volume did not sync up for me. I could turn down the music volume but the game sounds would still be unbarebly loud. Obviously thats isn't supposed to happen.

          2nd. None of the settings in which I could change actually did something. My FOV never changed when either increasing it or decreasing it. My sensitivity never changed when either increasing it or decreasing it. The very little graphics options available never had any effect on playability. I couldn't even change my keybindings. Nothing would save after being changed. Even after relaunching the game and reinstalling.

          3rd. This game cost $10(off-sale). Now i understand that this game is in Early access, I do however believe that the problems that I was having should not be happeneing even in the current game state. I have requested a refund and will be getting my money back. 

           All that being said, I do very much enjoy these types of games(FPS 3D-Platformers) so much that I will definitely come back to this game once it has been fully released and plays like a dream. The best thing I can do now is to warn people about the current problems the game is having. I wish the best of luck to 2xMilk and his dev team and I truly hope that they can make this game as good as it looks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169473400', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1488485436}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061689492', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1569697439}
review:
VThree is in essence, what its advertised as. Its a fun game with excellent speedrunnning potential, and a soon to be  level editor. I see great potential in this game, since it is just pure fun. The developer is also one of the nicest people I've met in this community, and he actually takes feedback into consideration. I will just say, if you are expecting some AAA gameplay with motion blur and a million levels, you wont get it here. But considering it is only in early access so far it is pretty damn good.

PROS:
Fast game if you want it to be
Great community
Global leaderboards in multiplayer (and soon to be singleplayer)
Decent amount of content and stability considering that its early access

CONS:
Weird sounds (for now, i heard its being fixed)

Other than the sounds i cant really say anything negative about the game. Great work Topher/MrWhoof :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197995676953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1512233125}
review:
*Really fun running and jumping game*

So this game is about jumping, running and occasional rocket jumping. You can load up different maps and try to get the best time possible. This can also be done in multiplayers. This kinda reminds me of Trackmania, just without the cars.

At first, it takes some time to get used to the engine. In fact, it does feel kinda clunky in the beginning. But once you get the hang of it the gameplay will feel pretty smooth and rewarding which is a ton of fun. 

You basically sprint most of the time while you bunnyhop from obstacle to obstacle. Bunnyhopping works by repressing jump mid-air and holding it (like in Reflex). Strafing works by just moving the mouse. Though, you can strafe extremely tight curves while keeping your speed which allows for some crazy movement (unlike in source engine where too tight curves cancel your air-strafe). Rocketjumping works like default arena shooters, but you can't use it to gain speed at the moment. Also, there's wall-jumping. All this makes speeding through the maps pretty fun already.

The game offers great replayability value. First, it's about finishing a map. After that, it's about finding new skips and shorter routes and trying to finish those.

Since it's early access and the Steam release was just yesterday, you can except a few bugs, like a clunky game-menu or keybindings not saving after a game restart (I remember even Overwatch having this same problem though lol). Though, there aren't any gameplay impairing bugs at the moment. You can also take a look at the public roadmap or the discord server to see when these bugs are getting fixed!

So, if you like jumping/bunnyhopping mods/maps from other games you'll probably like this game too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254556347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1680451636}
review:
Petite présentation rapide
---------------------------

VThree est un jeu de plate-forme 3D aux graphismes dits "Low Poly" plutôt minimaliste fait sous Unity avec l'extension Probuilder.
Inspirer en partie par Quake 3 et surtout du mod DeFRaG qui est orienté pour la compétition de courses.
Le jeu et relativement simple à comprendre bien qu'il faut avoir une certaine maitrise de saut similaire aux bunnyhop/strafe.

Ma contribution
-----------------

J'ai essayé et testé la version Alpha au tout début du lancement.
Vu la communauté grandir de plus en plus rapidement via Discord.
Contribuer à la recherche de bugs et fait des suggestions/propositions.

Le gameplay
-------------

Le but est simple:

Trouver le chemin le plus court de n'importe quelle façon.
Une fois arriver sur le carré aux particules bleues, vous gagnez une médaille selon votre temps. (Argent, Or et/ou Platine)
Des armes sont mises à disposition comme un Plasma Gun ou encore un Gravity Gun.
Des techniques sont utilisées pour aller plus vite comme par exemple tirer avec l'arme au sol.

-Un mode solo et disponible pour l'entrainement.
-Un mode multijoueur en ligne pour faire de la compétition.
-Un éditeur de niveaux sera prochainement inclus !

Les atouts
-----------

Je pense vraiment qu'il a tout pour plaire aux fans de speedrunning/parcours.
Le jeu et plutôt jolie graphiquement.
Le design et épurer et bien fichus dans l'ensemble !
Et l'éditeur apportera une bonne durée de vie.

Autres remarques
-------------------

Une bonne écoute du développeur qui est attentif aux remarques.
Encore pleins de choses sont prévus, le jeu et peut-être en Early Access mais je confirme qu'il est en constante évolution.
N'hésitez pas à venir sur Discord si vous avez des questions et/ou suggestions !

Voici la roadmap pour plus d'infos: https://trello.com/b/0Jr2Xyf6/vthree-public-roadmap

author: {'steamid': '76561198071352299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1488825397}
review:
This is a parkour game! and I love parkour games :)

This means:
 * You will probably fail on your first run of a level.
 * You will fail after that a lot as well till you figured out how to do all the jumps to get to the goal!
 * You will need to figure out where you have to go.
 * There will be always a shorter path than you know of.
 * Every round/run will help you to become better and faster in the current level.
 * Be ready to press that restart button of the parcour a lot of times! ('r' for restart, 't' for last checkpoint)


What I like:
 + Challenging Levels
 + A button to quickly restart the level
 + different jumping mechanisms (wall jumps, rocket jumps, change speed while jumping, ...)
 + you actually have to spend some time in the level and figure out how to solve it as quickly as possible
 + there are different ways to solve a level
 + worldwide Leaderboard in Multiplayer
 + the goal is to solve a level as quickly as possible, but the game also allows you to do the level on your own speed. That means you can also take all the time you need and do it really slow, what might help to find a good way to solve a level.

What can be improved: 
 - At this moment only 7 levels (Will probably get better as soon as the Level Editor is implemented)
 - In some levels you have to look at the ground a lot, because of the rocket jumps. I know there is probably no different way to do this, but I don't really enjoy looking at the ground that much. But that might be also just me XD


The random talk:
This game reminded me a little bit of Clustertruck when I first discovered it and I loved Clustertruck. And I have to say I wasn't wrong. I really enjoy playing the game and I really love the challenge that the game gives you. There is always a way to complete a level even faster than your last run!

The only downside is currently, that there aren't too many levels (7 levels). But as soon as the Level Editor will be implemented I'm sure there will be a huge variety of levels to choose from, since everyone will be able to create their own levels then.

The Multiplayer has a worldwide leaderboard by the way :) So it's made for all the speedrunners out there that wan't to show off their record time ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168358405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1488322779}
review:
Very fun so far! It's early access, but it has great platforming and gameplay, along with support across all OSes and relatively low PC requirements. But there is one thing I think should be added to the game:

Splitscreen/Couch Multiplayer. Useful for parties and stuff. Preferably, splitscreen games could be online games and have other players join.

I haven't seen anyone alse mention that, but I think it would be a great addition to the game. But obviously the main game and its levels should be worked on first.
